div.a: The Post-Apocalypse Survival Machine Nerd Farm

div.div: In 2007, one man began working on a minimum set of machines necessary to sustain a modern civilization. Here's what he came up with.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Su5cqI&via=Digg&text=The Post-Apocalypse Survival Machine Nerd Farm

div.a: Tourists In New York Flock To See Damage Wrought By Sandy

div.div: The dangling crane. A Chelsea building with its front ripped away. Sightseers in New York City are forsaking the Statue of Liberty and Central Park in favor of the effects of Frankenstorm.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkdkJQ&via=Digg&text=Tourists In New York Flock To See Damage Wrought By Sandy

div.a: Red Bull Mounts A 360-Degree Interactive Camera On An Formula 1 Car

div.div: Red Bull Racing has teamed up with Making View to give us a glimpse of one potential future: interactive 360-degree cameras mounted to the top of each racing car.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SD7ior&via=Digg&text=Red Bull Mounts A 360-Degree Interactive Camera On An Formula 1 Car

div.a: Your House Is Probably Soaked In Mouse Urine

div.div: The liquid enables rodents to communicate with one another. It's also at the core of our asthma epidemic.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TncSeB&via=Digg&text=Your House Is Probably Soaked In Mouse Urine

div.a: Chris Christie Was Romney's First Choice For VP

div.div: Campaign insiders reveal that Christie was Mitt Romney’s first choice for the Republican ticket, lending an intriguing new context to the continuing drama around the Garden State governor.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SE3JQv&via=Digg&text=Chris Christie Was Romney's First Choice For VP

div.div: SORRY SEEMS TO BE THE HARDEST WORD

div.a: Apple Intentionally Tries To Hide Samsung Statement By Using JavaScript

div.div: As if things weren’t already silly enough in the decision against Apple in the United Kingdom, the technology giant’s gone and made things even worse.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SDCOTk&via=Digg&text=Apple Intentionally Tries To Hide Samsung Statement By Using JavaScript

div.a: ‘Boys Meets World’ Sequel Series In The Works

div.div: One of television’s most beloved series from the 90s, Boy Meets World, may soon be returning to TV, in a sequel series focusing on Cory and Topanga’s daughter. But will Cory and Topanga be back too?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RDS0Ou&via=Digg&text=‘Boys Meets World’ Sequel Series In The Works

div.a: US Government: You Don't Own Your Cloud Data So We Can Access It At Any Time

div.div: The government's argument that you lose all your property rights by storing your data on the cloud could apply to Amazon's S3 or Google Apps or Apple iCloud services.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X6suYW&via=Digg&text=US Government: You Don't Own Your Cloud Data So We Can Access It At Any Time

div.a: Mark Hamill Spilled The Beans On 'Star Wars VII' Back In 1983

div.div: A long time ago, Maria Shriver interviewed Mark Hamill. The year was 1983 and they joined to discuss the last film in the first Star Wars trilogy, Return of the Jedi. But the fun doesn’t stop there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RxTxZM&via=Digg&text=Mark Hamill Spilled The Beans On 'Star Wars VII' Back In 1983

div.a: Before-And-After Shots Of New Jersey's Destroyed Neighborhoods

div.div: Using a special remote camera, scientists are compiling a cartography of misery that illustrates why this storm could wind up costing America an incredible $50 billion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VIiRun&via=Digg&text=Before-And-After Shots Of New Jersey's Destroyed Neighborhoods

div.a: How A Rubber Chicken Became A NASA Celebrity

div.div: Without a shiny new rover prancing around on Mars shooting rocks with lasers, it can be tough for other NASA missions to get attention these days. So they have turned to a rubber chicken for help.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PtjppU&via=Digg&text=How A Rubber Chicken Became A NASA Celebrity

div.a: An Illustrated Century Of 'The War Of The Worlds'

div.div: You can find covers of tripods, flying saucers, humans running at you, humans grabbed by tentacles, or just plain odd covers of this book which was first published in 1898.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VfWEbN&via=Digg&text=An Illustrated Century Of 'The War Of The Worlds'

div.a: What Is The Secret Of Life?

div.div: We may have the genetic information for many species in our hands, but we are still nowhere near predicting how this creates a living, breathing organism. Here’s why.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SDrWr3&via=Digg&text=What Is The Secret Of Life?

div.a: Almost Every Obama Conspiracy Theory Ever

div.div: Fake birth certificates, ghostwriters, teleprompters, a teenage trip to Mars, and more of the most paranoid and bizarro Obama conspiracy theories out there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UnEDCJ&via=Digg&text=Almost Every Obama Conspiracy Theory Ever

div.a: Watch These New Yorkers Celebrate In The Streets After Getting Power Back

div.div: Manhattan’s lower east side had the pleasure of finally getting its power back yesterday, after about a week of going without. As you can imagine, people were pretty stoked.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SEbjKQ&via=Digg&text=Watch These New Yorkers Celebrate In The Streets After Getting Power Back

div.a: A 3-D Printed House That Grows Like Human Bone

div.div: Using a biologically inspired algorithm, an architecture firm demonstrates an exciting path for large 3D printed structures.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YjCfC5&via=Digg&text=A 3-D Printed House That Grows Like Human Bone

div.div: Kevin Bauman began photographing abandonment in Detroit in the 1990s. While parts of the city have seen rebirth, much of it has remained deserted; those are the places Bauman has explored.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SyOI0G&via=Digg&text=Architectural Ghosts Of Detroit's Past

div.a: China And The Case Of The Missing Ping Pong Balls

div.div: A raft of regulations imposed on Beijing in the days leading up to the Party Congress don't communicate a steady hand on the tiller. Taxi drivers are expected to be on the lookout for ping-pong balls bearing reactionary messages.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wgl8Ty&via=Digg&text=China And The Case Of The Missing Ping Pong Balls

div.a: Who Owns The Pussy Riot Brand?

div.div: You weren't expecting that question, were you? Well, it's a big controversy now.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SCAcF4&via=Digg&text=Who Owns The Pussy Riot Brand?

div.div: The hard-core homeowners who fortify themselves against any possible calamity—from hurricanes to nuclear attack—are testing materials and technology that could change home building for the rest of us.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X591YB&via=Digg&text=Lessons From Ultimate Safe Houses

div.a: Hoboken Woman's Facebook Updates Tell Story Of The Storm

div.div: "Evacuate? Hmmmm not leavin my house!" one Hoboken resident posted on Facebook before Sandy struck. Later, her status read: "Game over! The Hudson River is in my living room."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YjsVy1&via=Digg&text=Hoboken Woman's Facebook Updates Tell Story Of The Storm
